sentence.text: Liver cancer is very common worldwide and the rates of hepatocellular carcinoma (phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation) have increased by over 70% in the last 2 decades in the US.
We present the cloning and characterization of a novel gene, microvillus organization (Cancer related gene-Liver 2), which displays high expression in murine and human hepatocellular carcinomas.

Using in situ hybridization, we show that microvillus organization mRNA levels are increased early during the development of liver tumors in C3H/HeJ epidermis development, and that in normal tissues CRG-L2 mRNA is restricted to the murine testis and human placenta.
